meanings.definition: To shoot an arrow from a bow.
meanings.sent1: He arrowed the target with precision.
meanings.sent2: She arrowed the arrow towards the bullseye.
meanings.sent3: The skilled archer arrowed the apple off the volunteer's head.
meanings.sent4: His words arrowed straight to her heart.
meanings.sent5: The arrowed flight of the arrow was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Marked with an arrow or arrows.
meanings.sent1: The arrowed sign pointed towards the exit.
meanings.sent2: The map had arrowed symbols indicating the hiking trail.
meanings.sent3: She wore an arrowed badge on her uniform.
meanings.sent4: The arrowed path led them safely through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The arrowed lines on the road guided the drivers.

meanings.definition: Pointed or shaped like an arrow.
meanings.sent1: The arrowed tip of the pencil was sharp.
meanings.sent2: The arrowed leaves of the plant resembled feathers.
meanings.sent3: The arrowed roof of the house gave it a unique look.
meanings.sent4: Her arrowed nails were painted in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The arrowed design on the shirt was eye-catching.
